response:
The subacute, progressive time course (7 weeks) in a middle-aged male strongly suggests a compressive etiology, either neoplastic or degenerative. The history of hearing loss raises the possibility of Neurofibromatosis Type 2 with an associated spinal tumour (e.g., schwannoma). Inflammatory demyelinating conditions are also possible but less likely to present as a strictly progressive hemicord syndrome without other signs.
